flexsdm 0.0.1
  • Reference

Perform environmental filtering on species occurrences

env_filtering.Rd

Perform environmental filtering on species occurrences

env_filtering(data, x, y, id, env_layer, nbins, cores = 1)

Arguments

data

data.frame. Data.frame or tibble object with presences (or presence-absence) records, and coordinates
x

character. Column name with longitude data
y

character. Column name with latitude data
id

character. Column names with rows id. It is important that each row has its own unique code.
env_layer

SpatRaste. Rasters with environmental conditions
nbins

integer. A number of classes used to split each environmental condition
cores

integer. Number of machine cores used for processing in parallel

Value

A tibble object with filtered data

Examples

if (FALSE) {
require(terra)
require(dplyr)

# Envirnomental variables
somevar <- system.file("external/somevar.tif", package = "flexsdm")
somevar <- terra::rast(somevar)

plot(somevar)

# Species occurrences
data("spp")
spp

#> # A tibble: 1,150 x 4
#>    species        x        y pr_ab

#>  2 sp1      -51981.   16322.     0

spp1 <- spp %>% dplyr::filter(species == "sp1", pr_ab == 1)

spp1 <- spp %>% dplyr::filter(species == "sp1", pr_ab == 1)
>>>>>>> main
=======
spp1 <- spp %>% dplyr::filter(species == "sp1", pr_ab == 1)
>>>>>>> main

somevar[[1]] %>% plot()
points(spp1 %>% select(x, y))

spp1$idd <- 1:nrow(spp1)


# 5 bins
filtered_1 <- env_filtering(
  data = spp1,
  x = "x",
  y = "y",
  id = "idd",
  env_layer = somevar,
  nbins = 5,
  cores = 1
)

# 8 bins
filtered_2 <- env_filtering(
  data = spp1,
  x = "x",
  y = "y",
  id = "idd",
  env_layer = somevar,
  nbins = 8,
  cores = 1
)

# 12 bins
filtered_3 <- env_filtering(
  data = spp1,
  x = "x",
  y = "y",
  id = "idd",
  env_layer = somevar,
  nbins = 12,
  cores = 1
)
# note that while higher the nbins parameter higher the number of
# classes to be processed (4 variables, 30 bins = 923521 classes)

# While higher the number of bins smaller the number of records retained
}
